result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine A Spoo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not associate with known drug users or be present in any place where drugs are illegally purchased/sold/consumed.

Defendant shall not enter establishments whose primary purpose is the sale/service of alcohol.

Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with the victim, his mother, or his residence.

Defendant shall not have any contact with anyone under the age of 18 years without agent approval, except Court will allow defendant to have contact with her son as set by any court order.

Defendant shall not possess any pornography or sexually explicit materials.

Defendant shall not access any computer or technical device without agent permission.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including sex offender treatment, and follow any recommendations.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall comply with sex offender registration.

Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed and only as prescribed.

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Same non-monetary conditions as imposed in Ct 1.

records.addlTxt: Def appears in custody & w/Atty Ryan J. Hetzel.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Probation supervisor also present in court.  PSI has been rec'd & reviewed; corrections/clarifications made on the record.  Argument from State and counsel. Court questions probation supervisor.  Satements from def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

$1000 cash bond revoked; Defendant held without bond; Defendant remanded into custody
Jury Verdict; Ct 1; Not Guilty; Unsigned
Jury Verdict; Ct 2; Not Guilty; Unsigned

Def in person & by Atty Ryan J. Hetzel.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State. Jury trial DAY 2; Case called at 8:25; State files amended information; Court reviews amended information w/ defendant; Memo from security given to court, copy of same given to counsel; Discussion re: memo; Juror brought in for questioning, juror sworn in and questioned by court, counsel; Discussion re: juror outside of jurors presence; Court dismisses juror; Discussion re: witness Sandmire, order of witnesses; State has concerns re: juror discussing case; Court has concerns re: potential mistrial; Defense requests individual voir dire of jurors; Each juror sworn, individual voir dire by court; Jurors brought in and admonished; Ryan McAndrews (WBPD Detective) sworn and testified;  State rests; Justin Brinks (JPD Officer), sworn and testified; Jeremy S. sworn and testified, Recess; Jury not present; Colloquy w/ defendant about defendant testifying. Statements from defendant, counsel; Defendant waives right to remain silent, Court accepts waiver.  Recess; Reconvene w/out jury; Discussion re: witness Sandmire, prior convictions of witness, defendant; Reconvene w/ jury present; Nicole S. sworn and testified;  Christine A.S. sworn and testified; Recess; Reconvene w/ jury present; Witness Christine A.S. recalled; Sidebar between court/counsel; Defense rests; Testimony closed; Jurors admonished and released for lunch; Discussions re: jury instructions; copy of instructions/verdict forms provided to counsel; Court recesses for lunch; Reconvene w/out jury; discussion re: jury instruction/special proposed instruction; Discussion re: sidebar during cross examination of defendant; Defense moves for mistrial, Court denies motion; Court reserves defense motion to dismiss; Recess; Reconvene w/out jury; Discussion re; exhibits; Reconvene w/ jury present; Closing arguments by counsel; Rebuttal by State; Court instructs jurors; Bailiff sworn and jurors released for deliberations at 2:24; Reconvene w/out jury; Court addresses questions from jury; Defense objects to St. ex 1 & 2 being provided to jurors, Court denies request for St. Ex 1, 2, 3, and 12 to be used during deliberations, at this time court will not allow exhibit 11 to be used for deliberations however will revisit that request if jurors specifically request that exhibit; Court grants request for St. Ex 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10, same will be provided to the jurors for deliberations; Recess; Reconvene w/out jury; Court addresses question from jury; Discussion re: allowing jurors to view ex 11, providing jurors transcript of testimony; Discussion re: corelation of exhibit 11/transcript of testimony; Court grants request for jury to review ex 11, Court denies request for transcript of testimony as there is no transcript of the trial testimony; Recess; Reconvene; Discussion w/ counsel re: question received from jurors re: verdict forms; Verdict reached; Jury present; Verdict forms given to court; Defendant found guilty on Ct. 1 and Ct 2.; Court polls jury; Court thanks jury and releases them.  State moves for judgment on the verdicts, Court grants motion; Court revokes bond and remands defendant into custody; Court will order PSI, sentencing will be scheduled at a later date; judicial assistant will contact for scheduling.  Record closed.

Def in person & by Atty Ryan J. Hetzel.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State. Jury Trial Day 1; Cases called at 8:21; Court amends the information to change the word AT to ABOUT in count 2, state shall file an amended information; victim is present in court; Court directs comments to counsel re voir dire. Discussion re: defense witness currently in custody; if individual voir dire is needed will be held in chambers; Discussion regarding order of witnesses;  Jury panel sworn.  21 jurors called to the box; Voir Dire by Court, Individual Voir Dire by Court in Chambers; Voir Dire by counsel; Jurors struck, 13 juror names called; Remainder of panel thanked and released at 10:38am; Jury sworn after voir dire; recess; Reconvene w/jurors present; Witnesses sequestered w/ exception of detective; Court gives preliminary instructions; Court will not allow note taking;  Opening arguments by counsel; Jurors released for lunch; Court addresses defense motion; State objects to motion; Argument from State, Defense; Court rules on motion: if victim takes witness stand Court will allow defense to ask question re: prior sexual experience; Discussion re: testimony of victim; Discussion re: preliminary instructions given to jury; Discussion re: testimony concerning text messages; Court will not allow text messages disclosed to the court last week to be entered as evidence, will allow questioning regarding text messages; Discussion re: time frame of Miranda rights/def requesting an attorney. Recess for lunch; Reconvene w/out jury present; Discussion re: questioning of victim; Jury present; Victim sworn and testified; Recess; Jury not present; Discussion re: testimony of victim; Defense objects to statement being presented to jury; Sidebar between court and counsel; Alisha M.P. sworn and testified; Eric Grinwald (WBPD Detective) sworn and testified; Sidebar between court and counsel; Court excuses jury for the evening at 4:36, to report tomorrow at 8:30am; Discussion re: JT day 2 witnesses, previous criminal convictions; Recess for evening.
Defendant's Motion and Brief to Admit Other Acts of Evidence
Affidavit in Support of Defendant's Motion to Admit Other Acts of Evidence with attached Exhibits A & B
Letter received from Atty Ryan Hetzel
Letter received from Atty Ryan Hetzel
Letter received from DDA Hanson w/attachments
Letter received from Atty Ryan Hetzel with attachments
Letter from Judicial Assistant for Branch 4 to Atty Stephanie Hanson and Atty Ryan Hetzel

Def in person & by Atty Ryan J. Hetzel.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Defense motions in limine.  Court questions State & counsel re witnesses, etc. for jury trial set to begin 2-1-16.  Court proceeds w/motions in limine.  Argument from State and counsel re each aspect of motion.  Re #4 of motion - if any CHIPS action filed, Court will review file on own.  Further discussion re #1 & #2; Court makes ruling on how to handle during jury trial.  Re #3 (photos) - Court will not allow photos to be admitted at this time, but will consider further.  Court reserves right to talk about other records if necessary.  Atty Hetzel to talk to def's doctor and provide info to State if Dr will testify.  Additional jurors requested.  Discussion re voir dire.

Def in person & by Atty Ryan J. Hetzel.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def's motion to suppress re cell phone.  WITNESS:  Officer J. Gerke (SPD).  Argument from State and counsel.  Court puts findings on the record and denies motion to suppress based on exigent circumstances.  Further argument from Atty Hetzel.  Court again denies motion re cell phone.
Def's motion to suppress re statements.  WITNESSES:  Det E. Grinwald (WBPD); Det B. McAndrews (WBPD); Christine S. Argument from State and counsel.  Court puts findings on the record and denies motion to suppress statements.  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Ryan J. Hetzel.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  DNA sample provided; Court informs of expungement right.  Court sets $1000 cash bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.
